intro: Doliocarpus paraensis, commonly known as the Paraensis palm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Arecaceae. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces edible fruits that are important in local ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
